{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.01853v1", "title": "Implications of recent LHCb data on CPV in b-baryon four body decays", "summary": "Motivated by the recent CPV observation, we investigate the CPV of b-baryon
charmless four body decays under the U-spin symmetry. However, we find that
only U-spin symmetry cannot provide effective predictions, particularly for
$\Lambda_b$ decays. For giving more useful predictions, we also give a simple
dynamic analysis. By counting the
power($\lambda=\sqrt{\frac{\Lambda_{QCD}}{m_b}}$) of each topological diagram,
we find that for the specific decay $B_b^2\to R(B_1^2 M^2 M^{\bar 2})M^2$, only
one U-spin amplitude can contribute in the leading power. Then the effective
prediction can be given as \begin{align}
  A_{CP}^{dir}(\Lambda_b^0 \to R( p \pi^- \pi^+ )\pi^-) = (-12.98 \pm
2.85)\%.\notag \end{align} Considering the $\Lambda_b$ can effectively produced
in LHCb, we strongly encourage a more precise experimental investigation of it.", "main_category": "hep-ph", "categories": "hep-ph", "published": "2025-04-02T16:05:00Z"}
